wikipedia_page.main: Francis Beattie (1885–28 December 1945) was Unionist Party (Scotland) MP for Glasgow Cathcart. Beattie won it at a by-election in 1942, and was re-elected in 1945, but he was killed in a road accident later that year.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1945 United Kingdom general election

response: *1946 Glasgow Cathcart by-election: Francis Beattie was killed in a car crash.

link_mentions.page: Records of members of parliament of the United Kingdom

response: The Glasgow Cathcart by-election of 1942 was held on 29 April 1942.  The by-election was held due to the death of the incumbent Conservative MP, John Train.  It was won by the Conservative candidate Francis Beattie.

The Glasgow Cathcart by-election of 1946 was held on 12 February 1946.  The byelection was held due to the death  of the incumbent Conservative MP, Francis Beattie.  It was won by the Conservative candidate John Henderson.
